alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 12:32PM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Lamoille Creek Above Lamoille affecting Elko County. Salmon Falls Creek Near Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto affecting Elko County. Bruneau River At Rowland affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lamoille Creek...including Test - Lamoille, Lamoille... elevated river levels are forecast. For the Salmon Falls Creek...including Salmon Falls Creek near San Jacinto...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Bruneau River...including Rowland...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Lamoille Creek Above Lamoille. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 4.0 feet, This is monitoring stage. Visitors to the lamoille canyon and the powerhouse picnic area need to use extreme caution around lamoille creek and other creeks in the ruby mountains. Pets, children, and even adult can be swept away in the strong current. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:55 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 4.1 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 4.0 feet. - Flood stage is 4.8 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 200 PM PDT.
